intro: Trachelospermum lucidum var. osmastoniana, commonly known as the Osmon's star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a climbing vine that produces fragrant, star-shaped white flowers throughout the growing season. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for trellises and ornamental landscaping.
